article.headline: Fordham 64, Iona 59
article.story: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y. (AP) -- Freshman Marcus Stout's three-point play broke a tie and Mushon Ya'akosi scored four points in the final 1:36 to lead Fordham past Iona 64-59 Thursday night. Fordham (2-2) went ahead to stay when Stout, a 6-foot-4 guard, hit a one-hander and was fouled on the play. He made the free throw to put the Rams up 59-56. Marvin McCullough tried to answer for Iona (2-3) when he broke free along the baseline but missed a layin. Ya'akosi then connected on a bank shot inside with 1:36 remaining. Ricky Soliver, who had 14 points, narrowed the deficit to 61-58 with a driving score before Ya'akosi restored the margin with a reverse layup with 40.2 seconds to go. Soliver's two foul shots with 16.7 seconds left provided the final margin. The teams combined for 41 turnovers, 21 of those by the Gaels. Ya'akosi topped the Rams with 15 points while freshman forward Bryant Dunston contributed 14. Steve Burtt paced the Gaels with 21 points. Iona led 31-28 at halftime.
